item.title: What Does the 2013 Budget Mean for Tech, Science and Booze?
item.description:
Blah blah deficit debt cuts reform monetary policy gah. Words. Very important words though — our new Twitter-friend George’s budget determines what the government spends and where for the next year. That has a huge impact on technology, science, and almost everything we care about. So, the budget is in, and overall it’s positive for [...]

item.title: Finally, Honest Hand Dryer Instructions
item.description: It’s always felt like something’s missing from your local public bathroom’s hand dryer tutorial. Something simple, yet crucial. Something like, say, this missing third step that Doghouse Diaries has so smartly proposed. Or maybe it’s more warning than instruction; your hands may get dry, but your shirt and/or pants will most definitely end up wet. [...]
item.dc:creator: Brian Barrett

item.title: Is Amazon in Talks to Create a Subscription Music Service?
item.description:
The Verge is reporting that Amazon is in talks with record labels to create a new subscription music service. Sources have told the Verge that Bezos and co have “shown an interest in… an on-demand service that sounds pretty similar to Spotify”. Details seem scant — to be honest, even that’s generous — but despite [...]

item.title: Cern Explains Why the LHC Has to Go Bye-Bye For the Next Two Years
item.description:
Science fans around the world were saddened when CERN announced its Large Hadron Collider would be shutting down for almost two years worth of repairs and upgrades. But as this video explains: that’s ok. Because when the LHC is powered up again in 2015, it will finally be able to run at full capacity. You [...]

item.title: A Nintendo Wii U Is Your Mario-In-Eye-Bleeding-Detail Deal of the Day
item.description:
It’s been revealed that sales of the Nintendo Wii U console have been more sluggish than a slug that’s trying to run a marathon while wearing hobnail boots and carrying a backpack filled with tiny bricks. Oh yes, pretty sluggish. So what can Nintendo do if the Wii U is to be salvaged and taken [...]

item.title: Watch a Piggy Bank Take on a Lawn Mower and Other Explosively Destructive Things In Awesome Slow Motion
item.description:
There’s no doubt, everything is made more awesome by slow motion. But when you combine things like lawn mowers, piggy banks, speeding bullets, light bulbs, coke bottles, explosives, and a filthy, stinking caravan, you’ve got epically mesmerising viewing right there. If this is the kind of thing you get on Danish TV, maybe we should [...]

item.title: ‘Death Wish’ Coffee is About as Potent as Sniffing Ground-Up ProPlus
item.description:
Are you the sort who looks at a treble espresso and laughs? Do you down caffeine tablets like breath mints? If so, you’re probably the target market for Death Wish coffee, a 200 per cent stronger-than-normal-coffee Premium Free-Trade Ground Roast Heart Attack. According to the disclaimer: “This is not your regular morning coffee.  This is [...]

item.title: Kingston HyperX Predator Review: 512GB of Flashdrive In Your Not-Even-Bulging Pocket
item.description:
Flashdrives are a dime a dozen these days, hell, you can even get them in cereal boxes. But what if you needed to store something really, really big, and probably confidential on an easy-to-lose stick? Kingston’s got you covered with its ludicrously expensive 512GB HyperX Predator USB 3.0 flashdrive. Just imagine how many nuclear codes, [...]

item.title: After Getting Booted From Google Play, Adblock Plus Goes It Alone
item.description:
The maker of Android advert-removal tool Adblock Plus is currently trying to circumvent Google’s ad-blocker ban by releasing a new standalone version designed to be downloaded straight to phone, avoiding Google’s app shop censorship entirely. The new version 1.1 of the app is now available for installation direct from the web and straight to a [...]

item.title: Leak Reinforces Rumours of “Always Connected” Future Xbox
item.description:
A new leak seems to reinforce claims that Microsoft’s next-generation “Durango” Xbox will require mandatory game installation and have an “always on, always connected” internet policy. The leak, from VGleaks and reported by Verge, provides screen shorts from an Xbox Development Kit (XDK) for Microsoft’s upcoming console. Those grabs state that each new console will [...]

item.title: Ideas For Saving the Economy: GET ON TWITTER
item.description:
If you see George Osborne pausing, repeatedly reaching for his phone and going quiet for 30 seconds during today’s budget, it’ll be because he’s joined the modern world and is live-tweeting the event himself on his new Twitter account. The Chancellor’s official account went live this morning, with a message claiming this afternoon’s budget “tackles [...]

item.title: It Took Five Years to Make a Truly Beautiful Android Phone
item.description:
Android has become an enormous success in part by appealing to a lot of people who don’t prioritise aesthetics. It’s no wonder it’s been relatively ugly for half a decade. But finally, it’s spawned a truly gorgeous object for everyone: the HTC One. Google’s take on phones was never meant to be pretty from the outset — [...]

item.title: Tegra 4 Successors “Logan” and “Parker” Revealed by Nvidia Boss
item.description:
Nvidia has announced new updates to the Tegra line of mobile processors that power a huge chunk of today’s mobiles and tablets, with a roadmap that covers developments up to 2015 shown off by the hardware maker. The Logan range will come first, designed to step into the breach once the Tegra 4 series hits [...]

item.title: You Can Finally Get the ‘New’ Jawbone Fitness Tracker in the UK
item.description:
The original 2011 Jawbone UP was notable for being one of the first fitness trackers, and also notable for sucking unbelievably badly. Nonetheless, Jawbone took the UP and last year released a new, ‘improved’ version. It’s been available in the US for a few months, but now it’s finally made its way over the Atlantic. [...]

item.title: UK Staying Nuclear as New £14bn Hinkley Point C Power Plant Approved
item.description:
The UK’s future electricity needs will not be handled by solar panels and turbines alone. We’ve got a new nuclear power station on the way, thanks to the government approving plans to build a third generator at the Hinkley Point station. The nuclear unit, which will take 10 years to build, will eventually provide a [...]

item.title: BB10 Fails UK Government High Security Testing
item.description:
The new BlackBerry ecosystem has failed a government security test, meaning it is, for now, unlikely to win itself any large-scale government orders. George Osborne’s going to have to carry on using his insecure ASDA Alcatel for the time being. The tests were carried out by the Communications-Electronics Security Group, which ratifies hardware and software [...]

item.title: Apple Credits Evad3rs as the iOS 6.1.3 Update Nukes Your Untethered Jailbreak
item.description:
Apple has finally patched the gaping lockscreen hole in iOS 6.1, but in the process it’s also killed-off the exploits used by Evad3rs for their Evasi0n jailbreak. In fact, Cupertino went as far as to credit the jailbreakers for finding the four of the six holes. If you’re running a jailbroken iPhone or iPad, don’t [...]

item.title: Report: Microsoft Is Being Investigated for Bribery
item.description:
The WSJ reports that the US government is investigating Microsoft for bribery. According to unnamed sources, Microsoft paid off foreign government officials to get software contracts. According to the report, the US DoJ and SEC are looking into anonymous accusations that Microsoft paid off officials in China, Romania, and Italy. Regulators believe that the company may have [...]

item.title: The Most Perfect Lego Apple II+ Will Make You Want a Lego Computer
item.description:
This Lego version of an Apple II+ is perfect. It has the lovely aged hue of beige, clear bricks for the Apple Monitor II, floppy disk drives with the right sticker and even a removable top on the computer to see the Lego computer’s guts! Made by Chiu-Kueng Tsang, a wizard with his Lego creations, [...]

item.description:

item.title: Report: Adobe CTO Kevin Lynch Is Going to Apple
item.description:
CNBC reports that Adobe chief technology officer Kevin Lynch is heading to Apple. Whoa! What does this mean? Especially given that Lynch has publicly trashed Apple in the past. According to financial documents filed today with the Securities Exchange Commission, we know for sure that Lynch is leaving Adobe: Item 5.02. Departure of Directors or Certain [...]

item.title: Apple’s Big New Hire Sure Doesn’t Like Apple Sometimes
item.description:
Adobe CTO Kevin Lynch — that’s the guy in charge of technology at a very powerful and important technology company — is jumping ship, reportedly for Apple. Which is odd, because he’s said a lot of mean, frustrated things about Apple! Lynch has been with Adobe since 2005, meaning he was lined up against Steve [...]

item.title: Horrible Grammar in Text Messages Could Be a Sign of a Stroke
item.description:
In the rankings of where you need to use proper grammar, spelling and sentence structure, text messages have to be in the neighbourhood of last place — right next to YouTube comments. It’s because texts are a mindless quick-shot form of communication, surely? But maybe writing poor word-vomit-texts points to something larger… like having a stroke? That’s [...]

item.title: Google Is Adding Animated GIF Search
item.description:
Finding the perfect animated GIF to describe your feelings is about to get easier—Google is adding new filters to image search that let you designate the specific file type you’re looking for. On the results page, there’s a button that says Search Tools. Select that and then under Any Type, you should see an option [...]
